page.title: 07LIFEBOATS
page.content: In 1870 a lifeboat called "The Godsend" was presented by Lady Bourchier, the daughter of Sir E. Codrington. Alifeboat house was built where Stow's Stores now stands, and a pullover cut through the sandhills. Later "The Godsend" was replaced by the "Landseer" presented by the sister of the famous artist. The need for a lifeboat was soon proved for on Good Friday 1876 a fearful storm blew up and three ships went aground. They were the "Don Antonio",a steamer from Lisbon, "Naomi", from Sunderland, and "Thorney Close", from Hartlepool. Today the nearest lifeboat is at Skegness.
